conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q placed at the midpoint between the two plates of a parallel-plate capacitor.
The electric field E between the plates of a parallel-plate capacitor is given by E = Q / (ε₀ A).
Q is the charge on each plate, ε₀ is the permittivity of free space, A is the area of each plate.
The force F experienced by a point charge q in an electric field E is given by F = qE.
Substitute the expression for E from Step 1 into the force equation: F = q(Q / (ε₀ A)).
The force experienced by the point charge q is F = qQ / (ε₀ A).
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q is F = qQ / (ε₀ A).
